text: After healing the man at the pool of Bethzatha, the Jews sought all the more to kill Jesus because

options.B: they were unhappy that He healed the man
options.C: He claimed that God His father was still working

explanation:
After healing the man at thePool of Bethzatha (Bethesda)on theSabbath, the Jewish leaders were angry because Jesus hadbroken their Sabbath laws. However, whatangered them even morewas His claim thatGod was His Father, making Himselfequal with God.
John 5:17-18 (RSV)states:"But Jesus answered them, ‘My Father is working still, and I am working.’ This was why the Jews sought all the more to kill him, because he not only broke the Sabbath but also called God his own Father, making himself equal with God."

text: According to Luke, the leper healed by Jesus was commanded to

options.A: tell people about the cleansing
options.B: make an offering for his cleansing
options.C: go and show himself to his friends

explanation:
According toLuke 5:14 (RSV), after healing the leper, Jesus commanded him:
"And he charged him to tell no one; but ‘go and show yourself to the priest, and make an offering for your cleansing, as Moses commanded, for a proof to the people.’"
This instruction follows theMosaic LawinLeviticus 14:1-32, which required healed lepers to present themselves to the priest and offer sacrifices as a sign of their purification.

text:
''It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him a helper fit for him''
After this statement, the first thing God did was to

options.A: make a rib into a woman and bring her to the man
options.B: take one of the man's ribs and close up its place with flesh
options.C: cause a deep sleep to fall upon the man
options.D: from beasts and birds and bring them to the man

explanation:
The statement"It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him a helper fit for him"is found inGenesis 2:18 (RSV). However, before creating the woman, God first formed the animals and brought them to Adam to see what he would name them.
Genesis 2:19 (RSV)states:"So out of the ground the Lord God formed every beast of the field and every bird of the air, and brought them to the man to see what he would call them; and whatever the man called every living creature, that was its name."
OnlyafterAdam had named the animals and found no suitable helper did God put him into a deep sleep and create Eve from his rib.

1 Samuel 11:13 (RSV)"But Saul said, ‘No man shall be put to death this day, for today the Lord has wrought deliverance in Israel.’"
This shows that Saul, at this early stage of his reign, washumble and attributed the victory to God, choosing unity over vengeance.

Peter encourages Christians, especially servants, to remain respectful and obedient to their masters, even when those masters are harsh or difficult. This teaching aligns with the broader Christian principle ofenduring suffering for righteousness' sakeand following Christ’s example of humility and patience.

text:
And let steadfastness have its full effect....
What does James say would be the outcome of this effect?

options.A: righteousness and faith
options.B: perfection and completion
options.C: trial and endurance

explanation:
James 1:4 (RSV) states:
"And let steadfastness have its full effect, that you may be perfect and complete, lacking in nothing."
James encourages believers toremain steadfastin the face of trials because perseverance leads to spiritual maturity. The outcome of enduring trials with faith isperfection (spiritual maturity) and completeness (wholeness in character and faith).

text: According to Paul, just as the law came to increase trespass, so sin came to increase

options.A: unggodliness
options.B: punishment
options.C: righhteousness

explanation:
InRomans 5:20, the Apostle Paul writes:
"Now the law came in to increase the trespass, but where sin increased, grace abounded all the more."(Romans 5:20, ESV)
Here, Paul explains that while the law made people more aware of their sin (increasing trespass), it also led to an increase ingrace. In other words, as sin became more apparent through the law, God's grace became even more abundant to cover that sin.

text: According to Peter, Christians who suffer according to the will of God will receive

options.A: forgiveness
options.B: blessing
options.C: the Holy Spirit

explanation:
1 Peter 3:14 (RSV)states:
"But even if you do suffer for righteousness' sake, you will be blessed. Have no fear of them, nor be troubled."
In this verse, Peter assures Christians that suffering for doing what is right is not in vain. Instead of being discouraged, they should consider it ablessingbecause it is God's will and it brings divine favour. This echoes Jesus’ teaching inMatthew 5:10, where He said,“Blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness' sake, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.”

text: King Josiah ordered an inquiry about the words of the book that was found in the Temple because

options.A: he realized that God was angry with Israel
options.B: the people demonded a prohetic interpretation of the book
options.C: he was very excited about the discovery
options.D: no one was able to read the words of the book

explanation: King Josiah ordered an inquiry about the words of the book because he was deeply troubled by what he heard when the book of the law was read to him. The words of the book revealed that the people had disobeyed the commandments of the Lord, and as a result, great wrath was kindled against them. Josiah was concerned about the consequences of this disobedience and wanted to seek guidance from the Lord through an inquiry to understand what actions should be taken in response to the situation.

text:
''... for if this plan or this undertaken is of men, it will fail; but if it is of God, you will not be able to overthrow them...''
Them in Gamaliel's statement above refers to

options.A: Paul and Timothy
options.B: Peter and John
options.C: Peter and apostles

explanation:
In Acts 5, the apostles, particularly Peter and John, were arrested for preaching about Jesus. After their arrest, an angel of the Lord miraculously freed them from prison.
Upon discovering that the apostles had escaped, the religious leaders were furious and wanted to take severe action against them. However, Gamaliel, a respected Pharisee and a member of the Sanhedrin, advised caution.
Gamaliel's point was that if the apostles' actions were merely human endeavours, they would eventually come to nothing. However, if their movement was from God, then opposing it would be futile, as it would be a direct opposition to God's work. Gamaliel's advice led to the release of the apostles, and the early Christian community continued to grow and spread its message.

text: Jesus declared that men loved darkness rather than light because

options.A: their hearts were hardened
options.B: their deeds were evil
options.C: they had no truth

explanation:
Jesus spoke about people loving darkness rather than light because their actions were evil. Light is often associated with truth, goodness and righteousness, while darkness symbolizes ignorance, sin and evil. In this context, Jesus was highlighting that people tend to avoid exposure to truth and righteousness because it reveals their wrongdoings and challenges their sinful ways.
John 3:19 (RSV)
19 And this is the judgment, that the light has come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light,because their deeds were evil.

options.A: take away their iniquity
options.B: accept their worship
options.C: bless them abundantly

explanation: In the book of Hosea in the Old Testament, the prophet Hosea calls upon the people of Israel to return to God and pleads for God to take away their iniquity. The emphasis is on repentance and turning away from sinful behaviour, seeking forgiveness and reconciliation with God. This is reflective of Hosea's message of spiritual renewal and the restoration of the relationship between God and Israel.
